definition: (of a house or room) to be for rent
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax

sentences.english: The eight-roomed dwelling house on No. 1500, Wuzhong Road, Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 上海吳中路1500號八室住宅一棟招租。

sentences.english: Please contact us for leasing opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 如欲招租，請與我們聯繫。

sentences.english: There is a room of double rooms apartment located at Cottonwood Crescent, Macquarie University available.
sentences.chinese: 麥考瑞大學附近有一兩房公寓的一間招租。

sentences.english: W:Yes, this small bed room is for rent.
We know this new shopping arcade is ready for lease.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道這幢新的購物商場已開始招租。

sentences.english: B:We know this new shopping arcade is ready for lease.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道這幢新的購物商場已開始招租。

sentences.english: Yes, this small bed room is for rent.
There are many apartments available in Guangzhou .

definition: (of a landlord) to rent out one or more parts of a property/(of a tenant) to sublet one or more parts of a property/(agriculture) sharecropping
to rent/to charter/to rent land or a house for subletting/fixed rent for farmland
borrower/leaser/the hiring side of a contract
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
